channel.title: Events on CURIOSS
channel.description: Recent content in Events on CURIOSS

item.title: CURIOSSs for Good
item.description: Join us to explore opportunities for maximizing social impact through collaboration between government, academia and industry CURIOSSs.

item.title: OSS Nexus Berlin - Linux of Cities & Public Health
item.description: Join us to connect and share with key stakeholders of the OSS in Berlin on the themes of cities and public health.

item.title: French Universities and CURIOSSs
item.description: At this in-person workshop, we’ll explore the CURIOSS for French Universities & Research Centers through internal, external, and system lenses.

item.title: The Dutch Public CURIOSS
item.description: At this in-person event, we’ll explore the Dutch Public CURIOSS, digital community goods and the potential for greater international collaboration.

item.title: An Introduction to The Turing Way
item.description: Anne Lee Steele will give an overview of The Turing Way, an open source, community-led handbook that enables collaborative, reproducible and ethical data science.

item.title: Designing Open Source and Building Communities
item.description: In this Community Call, Mike Nolan will discuss Open@RIT’s use of design methodologies to facilitate maintenance of open source projects and other key learning points.

item.title: Open Tech After Work - Stockholm
item.description: Bring your projects and peers to socialize together with us.

item.title: EUC CURIOSS & CURIOSS Networks In-Person “We Come Together Workshop” - Stockholm
item.description: We Come Together Workshop - Share, Learn, Cooperate on policy priorities through Open Source, OPSOs, and Digital Infrastructure

item.title: MidAtlantic Open Source - Baltimore Social
item.description: Come and join us at 5pm (EDT) on March 31 in Baltimore for an informal social where we’ll discuss CURIOSSs and all things related to them!

item.title: Measuring OSS in Universities
item.description: In this Community Call, Dr. Matt Germonprez will explore impact measurement of open source research initiatives in university settings.

item.title: Open Source Innovation in Universities
item.description: On March 24th, CURIOSS is organizing an in-person event in partnership with Trinity College Dublin to discuss emerging trends relating to open source in Open Science, Innovation and Knowledge Transfer.

item.title: OSS Licensing in Universities
item.description: In this CURIOSS Community Call, Cindy Chepanoske will share learning about OSS licenses from CMU’s Center for Technology Transfer and Enterprise Creation.

item.title: CURIOSS @CHAOSScon-Measuring OSS in Universities
item.description: Interested in measuring OSS in universities? If you’re at FOSDEM 23 or CHAOSScon EU 23, join us for this lunchtime workshop on Feb 03.

item.title: EUC CURIOSS & CURIOSS "We Come Together Workshop"
item.description: We Come Together Workshop - Share, Learn, Cooperate on policy priorities through Open Source, OPSOs, and Digital Infrastructure.

item.title: Setting Up University CURIOSSs
item.description: This CURIOSS Community Call will share learnings from universities who have set up CURIOSSs.

item.title: CURIOSS Teaching OpenSource
item.description: In this Community Call Heidi Ellis and Greg Hislop will talk about the educational opportunities provided by the TeachingOpenSource community.

item.title: US OSS Policy Assembly - Open Source & Open Science
item.description: We welcome you to the SECOND in-person meeting of the US Open Source Policy Roundtable. This full-day mix of unconference and attendee speakers will convene open source policy stakeholders across sectors to socialize, share, connect, and strengthen the growing open source policy community.

item.title: Semesters of Code
item.description: Semesters of Code expanded to multiple institutions in the current academic year. In this session, we will hear an update on how Semesters of Code has evolved and opportunities for future engagement.

item.title: Open Source Security
item.description: During this event, we will give an overview of some of the latest discussions on Open Source Security in the ecosystem and discuss how academic institutions can respond.

item.title: Setting Up University CURIOSSS
item.description: This call will be particularly useful for universities or academic institutions seeking to build and support open source capacity

item.title: CURIOSS Skills Workshop
item.description: This workshop is a follow-up to the Sep 22nd CURIOSS Community Call on Skills and Education.

item.title: Open Source Education and Skills
item.description: During the call we will be answering questions such as: What are the skills the ecosystem needs?

item.title: CURIOSSS in Academic Institutions Workshop
item.description: Workshop for the first phase of the process to create a Guide for CURIOSSs in Academic Institutions.

item.title: Universities and Acandemia & Cities and Governments
item.description: As 2021 roles to a close, we invite all those in the CURIOSS ecosystem, that we have interacted with virtually, in-person or have yet to meet, to come together, stop by and share in the group discussion, announce & celebrate your and other’s FOSS wins together, have a breakout chat with a friend, and join us for a drink.

item.title: Universities & Academia
item.description: Measuring CURIOSSs, Measuring Open Source, Measuring Impact - Theory to Practice When: 9am PT, 12pm EDT, 6pm CET on Thursday November 11, 2021

item.title: When Institutions Cooperate
item.description: This special 2 hour CURIOSS Workshop happened live from Paris as part the in-person Paris Open Source Global Forum (Nov 8) and at the start of the Paris Open Source Experience (Nov 9 & 10).
